item.title: To amend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 to modify the authorized uses of certain county funds and to extend the deadline for participating counties to initiate projects and obligate funds.

summary.summary-text:
This bill amends the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 to modify the authorized uses of funds a county elects to receive under such Act to include:

  • reimbursing the county for law enforcement patrols and evacuations that are performed on federal land;
  • search and rescue preparedness training; and
  • capital equipment, equipment maintenance, and other purchases related to carrying out search and rescue and other emergency services.

A participating county may reallocate funds received under such Act for a different use than authorized under such Act only after the 45-day public comment period has ended, at the beginning of which the county shall publish in any publications of local record a proposal that describes how the county proposes to use such funds.

The bill extends the authority for the initiation of county projects until the end of FY2019 and provides for county funds to remain available until expended.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
